sentence.Network_en: On arrival, a six-course meal was top of the agenda.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们到达之后要做的第一件事是吃一顿六道菜的大餐。

sentence.Network_en: Station staff announced the arrival of the train over the tannoy.
sentence.Network_cn: 车站工作人员通过广播告知火车到站了。

sentence.Network_en: The monument predates the arrival of the druids in Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一遗迹在德鲁伊特来到不列颠前就已存在。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Anglo-Norman French arrivaille, from Old French arriver (see arrive)

encyclopedia.content: Arrival 演唱者：莎拉·布莱曼 Sing sing sing the song they sang with us when they sailed away 唱吧，唱着他们远航前与我们合唱的曲子 Bring bring bring them back again to these lonely shores one day 回来吧，总有一天他们将回到这孤寂的海岸 We’ll be here awaiting their arrival 我们将在这儿守候着他们的归来 How that moment’s gonna shine 哪个时刻将闪耀着怎样的无限光芒！ May they ring then in our hearts T

entry.def: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, you can refer to their arrival .

example.ex: ...the day after his arrival in England...
He was dead on arrival at the nearby hospital.
example.tran: 到达附近的医院时他已经死亡。

entry.def: When someone starts a new job, you can refer to their arrival in that job.

example.ex: ...the power vacuum created by the arrival of a new president...
example.tran: 新主席接任造成的权力真空

example.ex: The company had eight departures and 11 new arrivals on its management board in 1980-1989.
example.tran: 在1980至1989年间，公司管理委员会离职8人，新吸收11人。

entry.def: When something is brought to you or becomes available, you can refer to its arrival .

example.ex: I was flicking idly through a newspaper while awaiting the arrival of orange juice and coffee...
example.tran: 我一边无所事事地翻着报纸，一边等着我点的橙汁和咖啡。

example.ex: The coronation broadcast marked the arrival of television.
example.tran: 加冕典礼的转播标志着电视时代的到来。

entry.tran: （某一时间的）到来；（某一事件的）发生
entry.def: When a particular time comes or a particular event happens, you can refer to its arrival.

example.ex: He celebrated the arrival of the New Year with a party for his friends.
example.tran: 他为朋友们举行了一个聚会，庆祝新年的到来。

entry.def: You can refer to someone who has just arrived at a place as a new arrival .

example.ex: A high proportion of the new arrivals are skilled professionals...
example.tran: 新来的人中很大一部分是技术熟练的专业人士。

example.ex: He was the most junior and most recent arrival at the embassy.
example.tran: 在大使馆里，他是职位最低也是入职最晚的一位。

entry.def: When a baby is born, you can refer to its arrival.

example.ex: ...a couple anticipating the arrival of a new child.
example.tran: 盼望着孩子出生的一对夫妇

entry.def: You can refer to a baby who has just been born as a new arrival .

example.ex: Her father was besotted with the new arrival.
example.tran: 她的父亲完全沉浸在新生儿带来的喜悦中。

means.word_mean: 2. the act of arriving at a certain place;

auth_sentence.content: Queen of the Night's arrival are marvellously hysterical.

auth_sentence.content: On arrival he discovers the planet's incredible secret.
auth_sentence.res_content: On arrival he discovers the planet's incredible secret.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On arrival he discovers the planet's incredible secret.

auth_sentence.content: It was a low-key arrival in a chilly rain.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was a low-key arrival in a chilly rain.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表示"河,河岸",引申为流动

stems_affixes.value_cn: 到来, 到达, 到达者
stems_affixes.word_buile: ar向+riv河,河岸+al表名词→到达河的对岸→到达

stems_affixes.value_cn: 引出, 来历, 出处
stems_affixes.word_buile: derivate引出的+tion表名词→n.引出, 来历, 出处

Sentence.sentence: I can't find the arrival time of the New York to Boston Express on this schedule.

sentences.en: His arrival brought complete silence to the room.
sentences.cn: 他的到来使房间里鸦雀无声。

jushi.english: They went out to welcome the new arrivals.
jushi.chinese: 他们出去欢迎新来的人。

jushi.english: His arrival brought complete silence to the room.
jushi.chinese: 他的到来使房间里鸦雀无声。

jushi.english: He was rushed to hospital but was dead on arrival.
jushi.chinese: 他被急速送往医院,但在抵达时已死亡。
